member.param: Specifies the subject of a context / specification.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.IFakeAccessor.The``1
member.summary: Creates a fake of the type specified by . This method reuses existing instances. If an instance of was already requested it's returned here. (You can say this is kind of a singleton behavior) Besides that, you can obtain a reference to automatically injected fakes with this method.
member.typeparam: The type to create a fake for. (Should be an interface or an abstract class)

member.summary: Configures that the function supplied by will be called when the method under configuration is called.
member.param: Specifies the function which is called when the method under configuration is called.
member.remarks: Use this overload when you're not interested in the parameters.

member.summary: Specifies that the behavior on the fake should only be executed once.

member.summary: Specifies that the behavior on the fake should be called twice.

member.name: T:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2
member.summary: Base class that adds auto mocking (grasp), I mean auto faking capabilities to Machine.Specifications.
member.typeparam: The subject for the specification. This is the type that is created by the specification for you.
Specifies the concrete fake engine that will be used for creating fake instances. This must be a class with a parameterless constructor that implements .

member.name: F:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2._specificationController
member.summary: The specification controller

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.The``1
member.summary: Creates a fake of the type specified by . This method reuses existing instances. If an instance of was already requested it's returned here. (You can say this is kind of a singleton behavior) Besides that, you can obtain a reference to automatically injected fakes with this method.
member.typeparam: The type to create a fake for. (Should be an interface or an abstract class)

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.An``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a fake of the type specified by .
member.typeparam: The type to create a fake for. (Should be an interface or an abstract class)
member.param: Optional constructor parameters for abstract base classes as fakes.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.Some``1
member.summary: Creates a list containing 3 fake instances of the type specified via .
member.typeparam: Specifies the item type of the list. This should be an interface or an abstract class.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.Some``1(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a list of fakes.
member.typeparam: Specifies the item type of the list. This should be an interface or an abstract class.
member.param: Specifies the amount of fakes that have to be created and inserted into the list.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.Configure``1(``0)
member.summary: Uses the instance supplied by during the build process of the subject. The specified instance will be injected into the constructor.
member.typeparam: Specifies the interface type.
member.param: Specifies the instance to be used for the specification.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.Configure``2
member.summary: Registered the type specified via as the default type for the interface specified via . With this the type gets automatically build when the subject is resolved.
member.typeparam: Specifies the interface type.
Specifies the implementation type.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.Configure(Machine.Fakes.Registrar)
member.summary: Applies the configuration embedded in the registar to the underlying container.
member.param: Specifies the registrar.
member.exception: Thrown when the supplied registrar is null.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.Configure``1
member.summary: Applies the configuration embedded in the registar to the underlying container. Shortcut for so that you don't have to create the registrar manually.
member.typeparam: The registrar type.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.Configure(System.Action{Machine.Fakes.Registrar})
member.summary: Shortcut for . This one will create a registrar for you and allow configuration via the delegate passed in via .
member.param: Specifies the configuration for the registrar.
member.exception: Thrown when the supplied registrar is null.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.With``1
member.summary: Configures the specification to execute a behavior config before the action on the subject is executed ().
member.typeparam: Specifies the type of the config to be executed.
member.remarks: The class specified by needs to have private fields assigned with either or delegates.

member.name: M:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.With(System.Object)
member.summary: Configures the specification to execute the behavior config specified by before the action on the sut is executed ().
member.param: Specifies the behavior config to be executed.
member.remarks: The object specified by needs to have private fields assigned with either or delegates.

member.name: P:Machine.Fakes.WithSubject`2.Subject
member.summary: Gives access to the subject under specification. On first access the spec tries to create an instance of the subject type by itself. Override this behavior by manually setting a subject instance.
